alert.note: Alert for Butler; Cowley; Harvey; Sedgwick (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 12:14AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Cowley, eastern Sedgwick, southeastern Harvey, Butler and northeastern Sumner Counties through 100 AM CDT... At 1213 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Elbing to near Eisenhower National Airport to near Anthony. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wichita, Derby, El Dorado, Andover, Haysville, Augusta, Bel Aire, Mulvane, Rose Hill, Douglass, Belle Plaine, Towanda, Benton, Udall, Whitewater, Leon, Kechi, Eastborough, Burden, and Potwin. This includes the following highways... Interstate 135 near Mile Marker 3. Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 21 and 41, and between Mile Markers 43 and 95. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
